channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for OK
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for OK

item.title: Report E-2023110308
item.description:
Report E-2023110308

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-08
  • City: MUSKOGEE
  • State: OK
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: GREENWOOD MOTOR LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: A forklift driver accidentally hit a pallet of drums with the freight they had on their forklift, resulting in a release of material on to the dock. The spill was contained and cleaned. All material was placed into an overpack for proper disposal.

  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: PKG ARRIVED AT NOKC 732 FROM DALLAS 753 901877. PKG FOUND AT THE BACK OF BELT 1 WET WITH INTERNAL LEAKAGE DUE TO LOOSE CLOSURES AND INSUFFICIENT INNER PACKAGING. DescribePack: LOOSE CLOSURES DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: PACKAGE AND CONTENTS WERE PLACED IN HAZ BAG AND HAZ TOTE

item.title: Report E-2023110414
item.description:
Report E-2023110414

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-01T18:14:07+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-26
  • City: OKLAHOMA CITY
  • State: OK
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: It was reported that approximately 2 gallons of DSB-1516 (UN1133) were released from a 5-gallon metal pail due to improper loading by terminal XSJ. The release impacted the inside of the trailer.The SDS was reviewed with the terminal and they felt comfortable cleaning up the release with PPE available on-site. (1) 15-gallon DM containing one 5-gallon metal pail of product and oil dry was left as waste onsite for the terminal to manage.
